summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, notifying them of a reproduction of discovery materials due to a Bates stamping error. The reproduced materials include Deutsche Bank records related to Jeffrey Epstein and a UBS subpoena return.

events.title: Discovery Reproduction Notice
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office reproduces and sends corrected discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel due to a prior Bates stamping error.

events.title: UBS Subpoena Return
events.description: A subpoena return from UBS bank is included in the reproduced discovery materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim, 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office discovered and corrected an inadvertent Bates stamping error in prior discovery productions for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The reproduced discovery materials include Deutsche Bank records relating to Jeffrey Epstein.
The reproduced discovery materials include a UBS subpoena return dated December 15, 2020.
The document confirms the government's ongoing discovery obligations in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The letter is signed by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss and addressed to five of Maxwell's defense attorneys.
